pr_title: feature(build): Trigger unit and integration tests in CodeBuild

timeline.message: chore(build): Update buildspec to build test APKs
Copy config files to all subdirectories
Commenting out ignored test causing build failure
Add ignore at the function level instead of class
Add code to pull amplify backend config for tests

timeline.bodyText: The test is @Ignore'd anyway -- do you need to comment the code out, too?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams

replies.bodyText:
I noticed that last night. The problem I was having is that it wasn't compiling because I had no credentials.json file. I was trying to generate the config files using the CLI so that file wasn't getting generated. I'm going to do that part as a follow up. For now, I'm copying the config files for the backend resources that circle-ci currently uses.
I'm going to revert this change.
replies.author: rjuliano

timeline.bodyText: Do we know how/why these tests fail? Can we add that description here, instead of this note?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -60,7 +59,7 @@ public void resetView() {
      * Tests that the app is navigated to the environment information
      * screen when the view environment information button is pressed.
      */
-    @Test
+    @Ignore("DeviceFarm does not appear to recognize ignore at the class level.")

replies.bodyText:
The comment at the class level states that:

"All of these tests timeout frequently with an error about the root of the view hierarchy never taking focus"

I can probably just switch them all to that. Ultimately I wanted to figure out why device farm doesn't honor the class-level ignore
replies.author: rjuliano

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/src/androidTest/java/com/amplifyframework/devmenu/DevMenuMainViewInstrumentationTest.java b/core/src/androidTest/java/com/amplifyframework/devmenu/DevMenuMainViewInstrumentationTest.java
index 7bcf8d81..93f21529 100644
--- a/core/src/androidTest/java/com/amplifyframework/devmenu/DevMenuMainViewInstrumentationTest.java
+++ b/core/src/androidTest/java/com/amplifyframework/devmenu/DevMenuMainViewInstrumentationTest.java

@@ -59,7 +59,8 @@ public final class DevMenuMainViewInstrumentationTest {
      * Tests that the app is navigated to the environment information
      * screen when the view environment information button is pressed.
      */
-    @Ignore("DeviceFarm does not appear to recognize ignore at the class level.")
+    @Ignore(
+        "All of these tests timeout frequently with an error about the root of the view hierarchy never taking focus.")
     public void testNavigationToEnvInfoScreen() {
         testNavigationOnButtonPress(R.id.env_button, R.id.environment_fragment);
     }

timeline.message: Add option to pull config files from S3
Addressing PR feedback. Moving gradle task
Inherit java runtime from android runtime
Copying different test files for report
Update docs in the buildspec for APK builder project
Pass device farm params in environment variables

timeline.bodyText: I believe this test is passing on CircleCI currently, right?  Why @ignore it?
timeline.author: richardmcclellan
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -106,7 +106,7 @@ public void setup() {
      * crashing the calling thread. Basic. 🙄
      * @throws AmplifyException Not expected; on failure to configure of initialize plugin.
      */
-    @Test
+    @Ignore("Needs investigation as it fails sporadically.")

replies.bodyText: This was supposed to be temporary. I'm going to remove the ignore. I was having issues with this one test failing at times both locally and inside the container. Need to do some investigating
replies.author: rjuliano

      */

     public void configureAndInitializeInLocalMode() throws AmplifyException {
         //Configure DataStore with an empty config (All defaults)
         HubAccumulator dataStoreReadyObserver =

timeline.bodyText: You can leave the @Tests in place, and just add the @Ignore, right?
timeline.author: jamesonwilliams
